newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Metlife plans 10-for-one share split.
newsitem.headline: Metlife plans 10-for-one share split.

text.p: South African insurer Metropolitan Life was planning a 10-for-one share split to improve tradability, managing director Marius Smith said on Friday.

The split would increase the issued ordinary share capital of 68.9 million shares to 689.2 million shares and reduce the market price of Metlife ordinary shares to about one tenth of the price prior to the split.
"This should make the share more accessible to small investors such as our policyholders and employees as it will be much more affordable to buy a reasonably-sized parcel of shares," Smith said.
Metlife shares, which closed on Friday at 80 rand, are mainly held by instututions.

Shareholders will be asked to approve the split at a general meeting on November 26 and the share split, which has been approved by the Johannesburg and Namibian Stock Exchanges, is expected to go into effect on December 2.
